website_summaries.verdict: If you are looking for discretion, the Pampers are more like cloth and less likely to make a lot of noise.
pros: Can handle pretty heavy wetness overnight
Designs are low-key for kids who do not like bright designs
Can work as a diaper for larger toddlers
Also comes in a design for girls' anatomy
cons: The sides of these can rip too easily

customer_reviews.title: Holds All of the Fluid Even When a Little Big on my Guy
customer_reviews.text: My son still has nightly accidents - he is a deep sleeper. He's in first grade and weighs 65 pounds. We recently moved up to this large size. They are perfectly comfy around his waist and a little big throughout his crotch, but the Medium size was getting tight on his hips. Even a little big on him, they still hold all of the fluid well, and he actually pees the diaper and stays asleep, so they are big accidents. I think his sheets have been wet maybe three times in a year wearing UnderJams. We couldn't be happier. :)
customer_reviews.author: TobysMommyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Leaker, Leaker, Leaker
customer_reviews.text: We had used Good Nites brand for a long time, but when my son started growing out of the S-M I decided to try Under Jams as they showed they worked for his weight. These did not work. Leaked every night, 2 nights in a row. I’m going home back to Good Nites, and upgrading to the L/XL. Unfortunately amazon has limited seller options on this brand at that size, but I found an alternate place to purchase. Interestingly enough when we first explored nighttime diapers we had tried Pampers brand and it leaked then .... looks like they have not improved their design.
customer_reviews.author: savvydiva

customer_reviews.title: Underjams have changed
customer_reviews.text: We have used these for several years now. My son uses the L/XL size. We have them on an auto shipment once a month. Something has changed in the last shipment, and it is not good! We thought it was just a new design because everything else looks the same, but he has leaked out almost every night that he has worn them. We even ordered another box to see if the one was just an anomaly...but it's the same new one that leaks. Not sure what we are going to use now.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: If you enjoy washing your sheets, get these! Otherwise, try GoodNites.
customer_reviews.text: I kept getting confused between UnderJams and GoodNites, knowing one brand leaked like clockwork and the other didn't. After working through a big box of UnderJams (and washing the sheets every single day), I ordered GoodNites and we haven't had a leak in 2 weeks! I'm not sure if UnderJams are more of a backup option, or good only for small children, but my son still wets every night and is right between sizes (so we size up) and washing the sheets became a daily task as long as we were using these. We will be sticking with GoodNites until he stops nighttime wetting.
customer_reviews.author: K. Lee

customer_reviews.title: work great for my 8 year old boy
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old son’s pediatrician tells us it is normal that he still wets the bed at night. These really work & help us have less wet sheets & get more sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Would be better if they made the front look like the front of boys underwear.
customer_reviews.text: These have leaked a few times but it may be because it’s really hard to tell by looking at them which is the front. Good nights and other brands either label them (back on backside) or the picture (of front of underware) makes it very clear which side is which. I’ve had to ask my son to remember to feel them and put the thicker side in front, which he may or may not remember to do. These would be so much better if they ditched the stupid shark pictures, at least in the large/xtra large size and make them look like boys underwear (think picture of the fly) on the front
customer_reviews.author: cyn_denn

customer_reviews.title: Great for big little kids
customer_reviews.text: I have an almost 4 year old who is off the charts for height and weight (43" and 65#) who outgrew all pull ups. He is fully day trained but still working on nights. These work perfectly. He could probably do ok in the smaller size but these are comfortable on him. Lots of stretch and appropriate coverage. It took us a minute to figure out the design and what's front/back, but it really didn't seem to matter. This is my second box now and no leaks or torn sides.
customer_reviews.author: amber

customer_reviews.title: Perfect cotton material and L/XL fits my 7 years old son perfectly than Goodnights.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect cottony material and I like the L/XL got the idea by another reviewer. I alternate between Goodnites L/XL which is a bit too big, it somewhat leaks but he stays dryer longer. Wishing for my 7 years old only child/son who is genetically down syndrome (very school smart and tricky) but zero independent to finally set on a toilet but until then I will continue to buy this product because I find nothing better. Front side has fake fly mostly with design, Back bottom flap is longer, side bottom seam is facing back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Leaks through every single night
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my 3 and a 1/2 year old son because he is potty trained but still has accidents at night. I am so very disappointed in this product. I tried these for a week and every single night, My son woke up crying because he was soaken wet which meant I had to get up and change his bed in the middle of the night. I really had much higher expectations from this brand so I am very disappointed and I did return them.
customer_reviews.author: dawn klasen

customer_reviews.title: Pamper your child
customer_reviews.text: I’m gonna pass on posting photos of a diaper. I have to draw the line somewhere. My kindergartner still wears a night diaper. It fits fine and it hasn’t overflowed. I wish they were slightly less costly.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: runs small.. worked out for us though
customer_reviews.text: my son normally will wear size sm med in the goodnights brand. I accidentally ordered size large in these because they were on sale. Surprisingly they're a great fit.. my son was 4 and now is 5 years old and about 50lbs so I think these run pretty small, considering the packaging says they fit up to like 118lbs?!?! I dont think so. Since it worked in our favor I am plenty satisfied with the product
customer_reviews.author: Wildflower7200

customer_reviews.title: Autism mom
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I found these on Amazon because I stopped getting incontinence supplies from the local med supplier over a year ago because they only have children sizes up to 6. My twins are 6 & weigh about 80lbs. (Dad is 6ft tall) they are toilet trained during the day but need something to sleep with at night. Where I live goodnights are $12/pack and they only come with 14. I was paying $48/month for 56 pull ups! Thanks Pampers of Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: EC

customer_reviews.title: Not for the husky kiddo, but do the job
customer_reviews.text: although these claim to go to 85# I don't see that happening unless your kiddo is very tall and slender. My 68# husky kiddo is busting at the seams. I'm hoping we don't outgrow them before they run out. They are very soft and trim fitting. These would be a good option for an older child as they are quieter than the other mainstream brand for sleepovers and such.
customer_reviews.author: Mama&teacher

customer_reviews.title: LEAK PROOF
customer_reviews.text: My son used to have a different brand of bedtime underwear but sometimes it leaked onto the bedsheet and mattress and it was a big mess for me to clean up. I thought there was only that brand available until I found this. It's life saver for me! It might be also a coincidence that my boy starts to wet much less after switching to this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Minh T.

customer_reviews.title: Very small fit and leaked.
customer_reviews.text: Got these to replace the disposable goodnights in xl size. These turned out to be even smaller even though the weight range is higher. My son is thin but tall and these wouldn’t cover his behind. He was hanging out above and below. It gave him a wedgie. And leaked horribly.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren LA

customer_reviews.title: Ordered these for my son not the best for heavy pee-ers
customer_reviews.text: So I ordered these for my autistic son. They were really small for the weight they say they are for which caused them to rip constantly. They also didn't really hold as much as I would have liked when it came to pee. I want to say 4 out of 7 mornings he had peed threw them or they were so full they just fell off him. Might work for smaller kids who don't pee as much but wouldn't suggest for a heavy pee-er
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: Typically I use Huggies good nights, but I hadn't able to find any in stock so I purchased these. They absorb fine, no leaking issues, but holy moly they are small. The slightest shift in either direction and my son gets a wedgy. They are the biggest size so it's not like i can size up. He wears a size smaller in the Huggies ones and they fit fine. I won't purchase these ones again.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine B.

customer_reviews.title: Better and cheaper then any I've used
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying Wal-Mart brands for years but was forced to order off amazon when my 12 and 9 year old ran out when a Wal-Mart wasn't available. They wet the bed bad and these are way cheaper and work better. They do have to use another pad inside but obviously that's cause they are so old. They still are better then anything I have tried. Now I only order these and forget Wal-Mart.
customer_reviews.author: Dubtub

customer_reviews.title: Small fit
customer_reviews.text: My first time trying these. We Usually get Goodnites large/X-large. I thought I’d try these out and They are Very small! My son is 70 pounds and right in the middle of the large/x large. So tight they barely cover his backside. I’m not sure they’d absorb properly. Wouldn’t order again.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Leakage !!!
customer_reviews.text: I usually order the same thing but it's not up to the mark this time... There is a lot variation It leaks, so doesn't solve the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Ashish

customer_reviews.title: cant find these in stores, and if you do they are a rip off, underjams are the jam!
customer_reviews.text: this is one of those products that are made for buying on the internet. you can waste your time at a CVS and pray they have this size in stock (if at all) and then you will be running back to amazon to get it in the end. good value, my son can put them on himself. happy customer! updated: we moved to israel and i had these sent here, this is how much better these are!
customer_reviews.author: DMV Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great product !
customer_reviews.text: I love these !! My son has autism and has a tough time at times and these are comfortable nobody can see them..theyre absorbent . also huge is affordable.all around just a 100% great product!!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Carroll

customer_reviews.title: They don't deserve anything it's not worth getting
customer_reviews.text: My son doesn't really like the way they feel and they don't absorb anything like theyre not even wearing anything, it doesn't matter if it's cheaper if it doesn't work it's worth spending the extra money for what works
customer_reviews.author: donna

customer_reviews.title: Great for day time use also!
customer_reviews.text: I like that the makers of pampers have this disposable under jams diapers. I had to transition my 3 year old to this training diapers because he was no longer fitting in the 4-5 Toddler diapers and this diapers give me 2 options to choose from S/M & L/Xl. My son is a big tall 3 year old weighs 54 lbs and he is using the L/Xl that fits just right. I would recommend this to moms whom are looking for training diapers or just need a bigger size for their child.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: They are made where they fit weird for sleep. More like a pad in the middle and thin stretch on the sides. My grandson has to sleep in a brace and can’t get up to go during the night. If he has an accident it can come out the sides. When we put it on you must be care or they will tear easy they pulled on they are sorda thin and fuzzy.
customer_reviews.author: kandy

customer_reviews.title: Does the job wish it came in one more size up
customer_reviews.text: Buy these for my 8 year old I wish they would come in one more size up since the L/XL is a little snug and adult diapers are WAY too huge. Because of this we do have some leaking issues due to them being a little tight and occasionally the sides rip when he is putting them on.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Leaked through..even when wearing 2 pair
customer_reviews.text: I am going with 3 stars because the absorbent quality is not as good as other brands I have purchased. Even wearing 2 at the same time leakage occurs from the sides, which means I have to do a load of laundry everyday. This is, of course, based on our personal situation, so they may work just fine for others individual situation. The material is gentle enough, soft to his skin and breathable. The design is as expected, except I have not seen any label for front or back.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Heim

customer_reviews.title: No more washing bedding every morning
customer_reviews.text: With all other overnight and high absorbency pull up pants, I was still washing bedding several times a week. No more! These are just the best.
customer_reviews.author: Gram Cookie

customer_reviews.title: Works for us.
customer_reviews.text: We have a huge toddler, who has grown out of size 7 diapers. This brand seems to fit him better than the other night time brands. Since we are using them as diapers I accept that they can get full, and then juicy or damp on the outer surface; so we are mindful of that. At night we use a booster pad inside, which really traps liquid. Overall I would say this is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: smaller than expected and not night time leak proof
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed in the size, as these barely fit my 60lb kid (and he is super thin!!). Unfortunately they were not as large as expected (wear like a low cut brief instead of full coverage). I also hoped to use this product for nighttime use. So while they absorbed a bit, they were not at all right for all night long wear. I had to change my son mid night and still had leaks. I will not purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: 11zmine

customer_reviews.title: Runs small but absorbs greatly
customer_reviews.text: My child relies on these too much due to how absorbent they are. Only issue I have is that the side weights on the box are not accurate. My daughter is skinny and only 4 but has to wear the size large. They definetly run small.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany

customer_reviews.title: Pampers surprised me.
customer_reviews.text: Defiantly better then Huggies x large night tim when it comes to the fit and the sides stretch more. The diaper keeps it shape a tone better then the leading competition. They hold a bit more urine then the others also. But we are still having leakage. They still bunch on sides. would give this a high of 85lb after that there ganna hurt. Your kids will need to be tall and slender.
customer_reviews.author: gems of jen

customer_reviews.title: Good fit, narrower inside
customer_reviews.text: Would have been 5 stars if the inside baffle was wider. The larger size is great; fits well and stretch is very good. Inside baffles that keep leaks in are more narrow than would prefer for larger kids. He wiggles around and I have to pull the lining out of his butt before he'll settle down. Other than that, no overflows yet; like with other nighttime standard diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Rickerish

customer_reviews.title: Pull ups
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping these were somewhat underwear-like, but they're pull ups. Not helpful for getting big kids to wear them without feeling like a baby. Do the job, though.
customer_reviews.author: Neptune5

customer_reviews.title: upsetting shipping packaging
customer_reviews.text: Product met our needs. However the packaging when shipping to destination was upsetting for the person receiving item. NOT placing into another box is unacceptable adding insult to a young child trying to overcome a hurdle in life. Advise to repackage sensitive items such as pull ups is advised!
customer_reviews.author: Georgette R. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: A lot of the diapers come already defective.
customer_reviews.text: The seal along the sides are missing on quite a lot of the diapers. Terrible quality, tears very easily. Poor absorbency too.
customer_reviews.author: Joe R

customer_reviews.title: Not for bigger kids.
customer_reviews.text: Not true to size compared to Huggies Pull-ups. These run smaller and shorter. They absorb fine, but if you have a big for their age child, these may not fit well.
customer_reviews.author: Little Green Frog

customer_reviews.title: These have changed our lives.
customer_reviews.text: I have an eight year old son who is a bed-wetter. He was embarrassed and I was changing the sheets every day. Everything else has leaked. These hold on 8 year old boy amount of urine and he can get them on and off himself. These have boosted his confidence and made my life easier
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Halligan

customer_reviews.title: Leaked EVERY time!
customer_reviews.text: In the past I've used goodnights with rarely having any leaks. I'm right on funds and these offer more in the box and the reviews seemed good so I thought I'd try them. Very disappointed as I've had leaks EVERY morning when he wakes! Safe to say I won't be buying these EVER again! Goodnights are by far better and their Tru fit even better!!! Sorry I wasted my money on these!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: We use these for our ten year old son. He wets the bed every single night because he sleeps too soundly to wake himself up. It’s saved the furniture and his self esteem. I’m vey happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ronda

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes wet is better than always
customer_reviews.text: Some times they hold sometimes they don't but for some reason my 8 year old still pees the bed but sometimes the occasional wetness is better than always wet and the price is the best I see
customer_reviews.author: liza

customer_reviews.title: True to description
customer_reviews.text: This product has been a life saver as we are still working on potty training our autistic 9yr old son.. they fit him well and as long as they are changed once he's had an accident they seem to absorb well.
customer_reviews.author: unknown

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: It was kinda hard finding large enough diapers for my 3yr until these.. My son luvs them.. He calls them big boy pampers.. And he sleeps all night without changing him..They hold alot..
customer_reviews.author: Bigmike1500000

customer_reviews.title: comfortable an leak proof
customer_reviews.text: My child says they are very comfortable and they have been very leak proof. Fits well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ok
customer_reviews.text: these pull ups were a bit small i went with the largest size but my son is pretty stuck and they just wasnt as fitted for his size that i would have liked not to mention that they ripped a few times putting them on.
customer_reviews.author: tamara

customer_reviews.title: Best nightime underwear for teens
customer_reviews.text: My teenage son recently started wetting the bed out of NOWERE! The alarms didnt work any and even when I woke him up during the night he would still wake up wet. Pull ups were actually his idea. They work great but I dont know If their going to help stop it. Another important thing, the underjams came in the underjams box! My son was not happy about that. Other than that I would recommend for heavy wetters.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: NOT the diaper for bunk bed kids!
customer_reviews.text: We used to use the Pampers Goodnights. They were very dependable for night time and a non-soaked bed in the AM. These were our replacement through My subscribe and save. They have leaked Often.
customer_reviews.author: Sherhildy

customer_reviews.title: Leaked through 2 out of the 3 nights we've used this brand.
customer_reviews.text: We usually use the "other" big name brand in diapers and pull-ups. I am very disappointed with these. My son has leaked through (a lot... not just a few drops) 2 of the 3 nights we've used these. With the other brand, he'd leak through MAYBE once a month. Now I'm suck with a case of these worthless things. Off to order more GoodNites.
customer_reviews.author: Mybutterflies

customer_reviews.title: Lesser alternative
customer_reviews.text: Goodnights brand is better because it fits a larger size group, is softer, more coverage and more flexible. I believe though these are a more cost effective choice.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa B

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: These are horrible. When you put them on there's a big bulge in the front and back. As soon as my grandson wet they leak everywhere
customer_reviews.author: Heather Walton

customer_reviews.title: Open box, missing 2
customer_reviews.text: Used these for a long time, but this box came open with two missing.
customer_reviews.author: s.s.

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Thank you!! My 2 year old grandson is thick, he’s wearing 7 and is potty train, these fit so good with a little room. He can pull them up and down to potty. Great product!!
customer_reviews.author: wind

customer_reviews.title: Good for bigger kids
customer_reviews.text: Great product if your kid can't get the whole sleeping dry through the night thing until a later age
customer_reviews.author: Michael V Clowdus

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: I regret buying 3 packs at once. I should have bought good nites instead. These leak every night and I am just gonna use them at dag time to get my money worth. I have used it for 3 weeks now and it's Useless
customer_reviews.author: Hana

customer_reviews.title: Very absorbent
customer_reviews.text: The only pull ups that didn’t leak when my 5 year old was still wetting the bed.
customer_reviews.author: Ozell B.

customer_reviews.title: Comfort
customer_reviews.text: They worked out for the time being. My son is 7 and disabled size 6 diapers were tight on him so I upgraded to these and they worked for him. Just a bit snug but they have elastic. My son weighs 65 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Gurvir

customer_reviews.title: Good value, especially when I can't get these in my local area
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was quick to my rural Alaska town, and the price was even better since these aren't even available here. They're equivalent to lower 48 prices. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Naomi Sasse

customer_reviews.title: Super absorbent
customer_reviews.text: Super hard to find a pull up that truly works and absorbs for an older child. I used to use Huggies overnight faithfully but when Pampers came out with their new version I had to try something bc everything else always leaked! Let's just say they are now on auto-shipment and it's staying that way!
customer_reviews.author: LuluLoves

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Use them on my autistic daughter for day and night time. Favorite brand for quality and price.
customer_reviews.author: Bree

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my son
customer_reviews.text: My son has autism and is 5. Having a little trouble potty training. These work perfectly for him he weighs about 60lbs. Fits very good.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Buy if you want wet bedding....
customer_reviews.text: These are awful! We were forced to try them because pull ups were discontinued from the subscribe and save. We are now washing bedding every single night! We may as well put our son to bed without an overnighter on. We feel like we actually paid money to have wet bedding every night.
customer_reviews.author: Mid Missouri Mom

customer_reviews.title: Leaks through every night!
customer_reviews.text: These are TERRIBLE! I literally wash sheets every single day because he leaks through them. And not just a little drip. They run very small. My 52lb son is in the XL size for 65lbs and up, and they are small on him. Which could be why he leaks every night.
customer_reviews.author: Lance

customer_reviews.title: Hard To Find
customer_reviews.text: These are worth every cent. Great quantity, absorbs well and fits good too. Downsize is the lil ones sweat more in the summer time due to the material
customer_reviews.author: Klutsy

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and leak proof.
customer_reviews.text: I used these for the past two years and my son never had a leak. I finally decided he was using them as crutch instead of learning to night potty train so I stopped completely. Happy to say we are still training but almost there. These are great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Presnell

customer_reviews.title: Awesome night time coverage!
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of my son peeing through his pull ups at night even after taking after supper drinks away. These did the trick!
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Did not like these
customer_reviews.text: Had no luck with this product. My little one wet through these. I am now using huggies goodnights instead.
customer_reviews.author: Momofmultiples

customer_reviews.title: No leaks
customer_reviews.text: These are great for my 6 year old that is special needs and has outgrew regular diapers. We’ve been using them for about a year now.
customer_reviews.author: Shayla M

customer_reviews.title: Works well overnight
customer_reviews.text: I love these pull ups. I've tried many of the more well known brands and they truly don't compare esp in quality and getting my little one through the night. Con: they tear too easy but not a deal breaker
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time but they did not follow my gift request which annoyed me. This should’ve delivered in a concealed box. My son loves these and he never goes through at night which is fantastic
customer_reviews.author: azenonc

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: These are great for my kids. They have trouble with going to the bathroom in the middle of the night.
customer_reviews.author: Tessa Rook

customer_reviews.title: Great design
customer_reviews.text: My son uses this at night. I like the design
customer_reviews.author: Ludy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit & absorbancy
customer_reviews.text: Glad to find these larger sizes for a late potty-trainer who was soaking through diapers at night. This size fits a 55 pound child very well.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Fit well but have a chemical smell
customer_reviews.text: I hate the chemical smell of these diapers and ended up purchasing Goodnites, which are more money. If you can get past the smell, they do fit well.
customer_reviews.author: Tjisagamerr

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: These work the best for my son (11 yrs) average build. And my grand son (8) small for his age. I have a subscription we like them so much!!!
customer_reviews.author: Beela

customer_reviews.title: Not good for bed time
customer_reviews.text: I'll never buy these again. They may be ok for potty training, but, not good for a night time pull up. My son peed through them, every night. You also cannot tell the difference between front and back. He always complained of a wedgie.
customer_reviews.author: April M Stanley

customer_reviews.title: These work great, but my child is disappointed in how they look
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Ninjajams, but got sent the regular ones. That's my only complaint with these as they're great for older kids who still aren't dry throughout the nigh.
customer_reviews.author: R. Crockett

customer_reviews.title: Poor absorbency
customer_reviews.text: The absorbency is poor. My child has woken up with a leaky pull-up everyday since we bought these. They fit well, but leak and can not hold the pee very well.
customer_reviews.author: PT

customer_reviews.title: I don’t recommend it
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son and it doesn’t absorb much he I’ll wake up wet
customer_reviews.author: Mia

customer_reviews.title: Leak through easily
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 3 year old instead of good nites... he has woken Up almost every night since he started Wearing these. We will be returning. Not worth it. Designs were cute and the price was good but the quality is seriously lacking.
customer_reviews.author: Chavonna bigham

customer_reviews.title: Not quite absorbent enough
customer_reviews.text: My bedwetter often wet through these unfortunately, it is hard to find a nappy absorbent enough for an 8 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Kaylie

customer_reviews.title: Size may not be what you’re expecting
customer_reviews.text: Still does not seem to keep the urine in. Also size lg/xlg are still not large enough which could very well have added to the first issue.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene F.

customer_reviews.title: Great and convenient
customer_reviews.text: Great price and super convenient to just arrive at your door monthly. It's the exact same product you can buy in stores
customer_reviews.author: Neysa Sturgeon

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Have placed several orders for these. The work totally better than major brand bought in a store. Absolute no leaks! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Purple Rose

customer_reviews.title: too much like a diaper
customer_reviews.text: it does what its supposed to do, but I just wish it didn't look EXACTLY like a diaper ... especially when an older boy has to wear them
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: They fit and absorbency needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: My son is two and frankly every time he pees it comes out either early morning or bedtime. These really have poor absorbency!!
customer_reviews.author: Andy & Ari Mosqueda

customer_reviews.title: Excellent diapers!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been purchasing this diaper for my baby for months and they are very good and comfortable. I buy a box every 10 day. I wish the box came bigger (with more diapers).
customer_reviews.author: Loanny

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow
customer_reviews.text: You can't talk what part goes in the front or back most say back on the back of the diaper this don't 😡 so I'm like what part look bigger for the back part but they seem to be the same size front and back and since my son got a big behind this are too narrow for him huh
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: The sides kept ripping.
customer_reviews.text: It kept ripping on the sides it’s good for absorbency but not for durability.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Lahpai

customer_reviews.title: Prevents side leaks from erections in older boys. It's a thing.
customer_reviews.text: It does prevent leaks from erections better. This is a problem, as boys get older. I hope my son'd brain starts waking him up soon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Does the job. We always get these. Better than the others
customer_reviews.author: kathryn Venechanos

customer_reviews.title: Size discrepancy
customer_reviews.text: These weren’t like the regular pull-ups that comes out of Walmart or any other store. The L/XL are bigger in the store, Those ones goes over 100 lbs and these went to 85 pounds. So I gave it four stars because my son can’t wear them because of the size discrepancy.
customer_reviews.author: Arlena

customer_reviews.title: Great pull ups
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my little guy. Holds up well overnight and fit really well
customer_reviews.author: Mary Bird

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my 65# 6 year old who occasionally has an accident. I have never had a leak.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Dalrymple

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Theses diapers are perfect for my 2 1/2 yrs old son. No leaks. I know many mothers can relate when they have a chunky kid. My son no longer can wear size 7 diapers so these were the next best solution.
customer_reviews.author: Kellie

customer_reviews.title: Great option for stocky boys
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 5 year old night time wetter. Very generous in size (he wears a size 8 boys) with no leaking.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn Seaholm

customer_reviews.title: Not for bigger kids
customer_reviews.text: Did not work! My child is about 60 lbs and these did not work at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great diaper for overnight
customer_reviews.text: These are great during the day and night for my older child, who has autism and is not potty trained yet. Never leak.
customer_reviews.author: J. H Sparks

customer_reviews.title: Ripping to easy
customer_reviews.text: It was more breathable than the others brand however it ripped too easy. Cancel my subscription.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: So leaky!!
customer_reviews.text: They work..... sometimes. About half the mornings I’m still cleaning sheets because of leaks. I won’t be purchasing this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie S

customer_reviews.title: Great brand!
customer_reviews.text: Just as good as the GoodNites brand but way better on price. Love them so much we subscribed!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Albach

product_meta.title: Pampers UnderJams Disposable Bedtime Underwear for Boys, Size L/XL, 42 Count, Super Pack
product_meta.description:
Bedtime Underwear with Pampers Leak Protection

BRAND STORY
By Pampers
feature_bullets: Recommended Weight: 58 - 85 Pounds. Bedtime Underwear with Pampers Leak Protection
NightLock technology locks away wetness for a dry morning
Made with cloth-like material that's quiet and helps give your child the privacy he wants
Low waist, so only your son will know he's wearing them
Designed like underwear to help let skin breathe

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
